publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in ŠorčuqStadthöhleduring T III Š 68.21

sourceDesc.p: Transcription and translation are based on .

Transcription and references have been transferred from the "Text and Reference Database of the Tocharian A Language" (Gerd Carling Lund University) (funded by the Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation and SCAS).

seg.seg: ... all that appears on the body of the Buddha Maitreya without flaw [and] (exactly) ///
Das alles wird am Körper des Buddha Maitreya ohne Makel gesehen.
All this is seen without fault on the body of the Buddha Maitreya.
[The buddha Maitreya], moved by his great compassion, says: two [bodies they are]. the bodies of the buddha. The one stems from father and mother, the second [of them stems] (from the Law) ///
[the body] equipped (with the 80 secondary marks), solid as the solidity of diamond, full of the power of unlimited power ///
/// [everything that can be seen] is [to be] seen without fault [and] clearly ///
These 18 Dharmas (are called the body of the) Dharma ///
equipped with a high and well [formed] instep ///
standing [he has] the capacity of touching the caps of his two knees ///
the sign (kośagata) ... the tenth mark. || Like the Nyagrodha tree his body [is] of equal proportions [and] round ///
(...the bod)y. 11th mark. || On the body, extremely delicate ([and] of blue colour are the curls of [his] body hair) ///
having produced a colour, he is pure, shining and having a skin of the coulour of gold like Jambūnada gold ///

p.note: This fragment contains part of the twenty-sixth act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka. An Uy. parallel would be MaitrHami 26, Blatt A-Br, but see 204.
Fragment of a manuscript which includes A 251 - A 294 (cf. 64-65). Lines a6-8 and b1-3 are lost.
The second word is täm here, as in 206 and 71. 153 has säm. MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a2-3 contains the end of the Uy. parallel passage.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A a4-13.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a16-19.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a20-22.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a26-28.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a4-5.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a7-9.

Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a10-14; the Uy. version of the first half of this line corresponds to the text attested in b7, the equivalent of which may also have been contained in the lacuna between the fragment of line b5 and b6 here. The Hami version of the second half of this line is somewhat more elaborate (cf. 210).
Parallel passage to the second half of this line: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a19-20.
Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a24-25.

div.p: Edition153. Siegling's personal copy of p. 153.

list.item: Fragment of a manuscript which includes A 251 - A 294 (cf. [[Geng et al. 2004a]]: 64-65). Lines a6-8 and b1-3 are lost.

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 Das alles wird am Körper des Buddha Maitreya ohne Makel gesehen. 232


b5 is restored to read (kä)lymāṃ kanweṃṣinās tāpäkyā(s tkālune) in [[Carling, DThTA]]: 123 (TI)

a1 ṣ : puk täm metrak ptāñkte kapśiññaṃ sne wärce lkātär ā(neñci) /// (tsopatsäṃ kāruṇyo) a2 rarätku traṅkas we täṣ siṃhe ptāñkte kapśiññāñ säṃ pācar mācarṣi wci (märkampalṣi) /// (oktuk yetwesyo) a3 yetus waśirṣiṃ prākroneyo prākri • sne āk tampeyntu«†o»yo tampe /// a4 sne wärce āneñci lkātär /// (tom śäk okät|o)|kät a5 pi märkampalntu (märka)mp(alṣi kapśañi klawanträ) /// b4 (tpo kās)w(e) särk peyu(m) /// kälymāṃ|(kä)|lymāṃ b5 kanweṃṣinās tāpäkyā(s tkālune) /// (gośagat ṣotre|ṣo)|tre b6 śkänt lakṣaṃ 10 || nyagrot_(TA)|nyagrot ṣtāmm oki sam parimaṇḍal kapś(añi) /// kapśañi|(kapśa)|ñi b7 śäkṣapint lakṣaṃ : 11 || kapśiññā lyutār memaṣ lālaṃṣke (tseṃ yokaṣiñi spartwañ) /// b8 || yok yāmu jambunāt wäss oki āṣtär lukśanu wsā yok ya(ts) ///

a1 ... all that appears on the body of the Buddha Maitreya without flaw [and] (exactly) /// a2 [The buddha Maitreya], moved by his great compassion, says: two [bodies they are]. the bodies of the buddha. The one stems from father and mother, the second [of them stems] (from the Law) /// a3 [the body] equipped (with the 80 secondary marks), solid as the solidity of diamond, full of the power of unlimited power /// a4 /// [everything that can be seen] is [to be] seen without fault [and] clearly /// a5 These 18 Dharmas (are called the body of the) Dharma /// b4 equipped with a high and well [formed] instep /// b5 standing [he has] the capacity of touching the caps of his two knees /// b6 the sign (kośagata) ... the tenth mark. || Like the Nyagrodha tree his body [is] of equal proportions [and] round /// b7 (...the bod)y. 11<sup>th</sup> mark. || On the body, extremely delicate ([and] of blue colour are the curls of [his] body hair) /// b8 having produced a colour, he is pure, shining and having a skin of the coulour of gold like Jambūnada gold ///

a1 _ṣ\ : pu_k _t_a_m\ metra_k\ ptāñkte kapśiññaṃ sne wärce lkā_t_a_r\ ā /// a2 ra_r_atku traṅkas we _t_aṣ siṃhe ptāñkte kapśiññāñ _s_aṃ pācar mā«ca»rṣi w[c]i /// a3 yetus waśirṣiṃ prākroneyo prākri • sne āk tampeyntuoyo tam[p]e /// a4 sne wärce āneñci lkā_t_a_r\ /// a5 _k_at pi _m_arkampal[nt]u – – mp· /// b4 ·w· [_s]_ar_k\ peyu /// b5 lymāṃ kanweṃṣinās tā_p_akyā /// b6 tre ś_k_an_t\ lakṣaṃ 10 || nyagro_t\ ṣtāmm oki sam parimaṇḍal ka[pś]· /// b7 ñi śäkṣapin_t\ lakṣaṃ : 10-1 || kapśiññā lyutār memaṣ lālaṃṣke /// b8 || yok yāmu jambunāt wäss oki ā_ṣ_t_ar lukśanu wsā yok ya–\ ///

This fragment contains part of the twenty-sixth act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka. An Uy. parallel would be MaitrHami 26, Blatt A-Br, but see [[Pinault 1999]]: 204.

a1. The second word is täm here, as in [[Pinault 1999]]: 206 and [[Thomas 1997]]: 71. [[TochSprR(A)]]: 153 has säm. MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a2-3 contains the end of the Uy. parallel passage.

a2. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A a4-13.

a3. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a16-19.

a4. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a20-22.

a5. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. A, a26-28.

b4. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a4-5.

b5. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a7-9.

b6. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a10-14; the Uy. version of the first half of this line corresponds to the text attested in [[YQ II.4]] b7, the equivalent of which may also have been contained in the lacuna between the fragment of line b5 and b6 here. The Hami version of the second half of this line is somewhat more elaborate (cf. [[Pinault 1999]]: 210).

b7. Parallel passage to the second half of this line: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a19-20.

b8. Parallel passage: MaitrHami 26, Bl. B, a24-25.

div.p: is restored to read (kä)lymāṃ kanweṃṣinās tāpäkyā(s tkālune) in <citedRange>123</citedRange></bibl> (TI)</p></project_comment>
